dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the back of AMY DUNNE’S HEAD, resting on a pillow.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I picture cracking her lovely skull, unspooling her brain, Nick runs his fingers into Amy's hair.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Trying to get answers. He twirls and twirls a lock, a screw tightening.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The primal questions of a marriage: What are you thinking? How are you feeling? What have we done to each other? AMY wakes, turns, gives a look of alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A carved faux-marble entry—reading FOREST GLEN—ushers us a ruined HOUSING DEVELOPMENT. Mostly VACANT houses. A few Fourth of July decorations hang in windows. A weird, BUCO air: swaying grasses, stray wildlife. EXT. NICK DUNNE’S FRONT YARD - DAWN 3

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: JULY 5th, 2012

dialogues.speaker: THE MORNING OF
dialogues.text: NICK DUNNE, 30s, handsome, is taking out the trash; his y is the only one mowed—all around him WILDERNESS encroache The SUN rises over the treeline and blares its FIRST-DEGR SPOTLIGHT in his face. He looks ILL.  GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 2. He turns and stares back at his HOUSE as if girding himse He strides across the yard, opens the door. His shadowy figure fills the doorway for a moment. He SHUTS the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK-wearing noticeably different clothes—arrives under a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: glaring SUN. Down the street, a troupe of HOMELESS MEN wa single file along the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick's twin sister, GO, 30s, nerdy-hot, is washing mugs. bar is packed with ‘80s kitsch: board games, toys, poster Their very own CLUBHOUSE. Go Ah, the Irish prince graces us with his presence. He sits on the bar's customer side. She flicks suds at hi

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Brought you a present. He sets a decrepit ‘70s-era Master Mind on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: (sweet smile) Master Mind! I hated this game!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You loved it.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: You loved it. Thanks. She places it behind the bar alongside SORRY!, CLUE, LIFE

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Pour me a bourbon, would ya? GO glances pointedly at the clock: 11:09 a.m. She pours t bourbons. Settles in. Go What’s up, Jitters? He shrugs. She tries to wait him out. Fails.  He smiles. GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 3. GO (CONT’D) If you don’t talk, I’1ll fill the silence with: an Excruciating Story by Margo Dunne. This is an old, reliable routine. GO (CONT’D) I could tell you about my customer- service experience while changing Internet providers.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I do like that one.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Or the time I saw a woman who looked exactly like my friend Monica but it wasn’t Monica, it was a stranger-~

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: -whose name was...Monica.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Made it kind of interesting. She gives a look: Talk.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s a bad day.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Amy?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Our anniversary. Five.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Five?! That came fast.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: And furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP on a PEN, cursiving across a DIARY. The pen is GI topped with pink feathers. We see at the top: January 8, 2005. We hear the words as we see them written in pink.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m so crazy, stupid happy.  GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMY ELLIOTT, early 30s, gorgeous, is in a crowded hipster party. Dude-heavy. She weaves her way through the guys.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I met a boy. She spots her FRIEND deep-flirting a guy, and stops midwa stuck with TWO BEERS. She makes her way toward a table wi picked-over food and scans the room for anyone she knows. spots NICK DUNNE~he spots her.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A great, gorgeous, sweet, cool-ass guy. Nick weaves his way over. She’s setting down her beer.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It's dangerous to set down a monk- brewed Belgian wheat beer when the party is down to three Beast Lites and a bottle of Pucker.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Might attract some desperate characters. He gestures toward a group of Williamsburg musician-types suspenders and broad-brimmed hats.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Things could get ugly. The Amish are on Rumspringa.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: They already relieved me of my artisanal meat platter.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Finally, someone to tell me how to pronounce that word.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Meat?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: One syllable. He picks up the beer.  GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 5.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whose beer am I drinking? (moving closer to her, so they have same POV) What's your type? They scan the crowd together. Cozy. Nick points to a horn rimmed, haughty DOUCHEBAG. NICK (CONT’D) I can’t picture you sitting still while he bloviates about his post- grad thesis on Proust. Nick points to a sideburned guy in a NOVELTY TEE.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ironic hipster so self-aware he makes everything a joke?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I prefer men who are funny, not “funny.” Nick points to a wavy-haired granola-yoga type.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Please tell me it’s not Deeply Sensitive Emo-Dude-

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: -who says things like “I love strong women.”

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Code for “I hate strong women.” A beat as they scan the room, then face each other.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: And what type are you?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Corn-fed, salt-of the earth Missouri guy.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Missouri?! How cute.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Ah: native New Yorker! ee eH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee OK  GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 6.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: World ends at the Hudson. I’m Amy.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: So tell me, Amy. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: A. I am an award-winning scrimshander. B. I am a moderately influential warlord. Cc. I write personality quizzes for magazines.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (taking her hand) A. Your fingers are far too delicate for real scrimshaw work. B. I am a charter subscriber to Middling Warlord Weekly—I'm sure I'd recognize you. So: C.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: And you? Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I’m the guy to save you from all this awesomeness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head down: tipsy, not touching, but thinking about i

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: So if you write for a men’s Magazine, does that make you an expert on being a man?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: In theory, I know what men drink, what men wear-

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: How men bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Not with you. Amy laughs: ha, ha.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m serious. She stops, studies him.  10 GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 7.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It's hard to believe you. I think it’s your chin.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: My chin?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It’s quite villainous. She places a finger over his chin. Tests the view.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No bullshit. 100% truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are huddling together, walking to hail a cab.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I love New York parties because I get to leave and walk out into New York. The Great What Next? They turn the corner and step into a cloud of powdered su as it’s funneled into a bakery. A SUGAR SNOWSTORM. Nick grins: Like this!

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know I have to kiss you now.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I would be a fool to let you walk through a sugar storm unkissed. The sugar floats all around them. A fairytale. They lean

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold on. Nick brushes her lips clean. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHABBY, CRAMPED garden studio apartment. BARS on the windows. NICK and AMY are in bed: blissful. Outside, a ca headlights flash: Their sugary prints light up the headbo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 8.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Nick Dunne. I really like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Master Mind sits untouched as GO sets up LIFE.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: So is Amy going to do one of her anniversary—whaddaya call it?- treasure hunts?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You mean the forced march designed to point out what an uncaring, oblivious asshole I am.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Wow. Silence. Nick stares at the LIFE board.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: LIFE. I don’t remember the point.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Deep Hasbro thoughts. Spin. What was the clue last year she got so mad about?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (reciting) “When your poor Amy has a cold; this dessert just must be sold.”

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: The answer?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I don’t know, Go! NICK spins, moves his man, lands on Get Married.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Few years ago—you’d have known. GO places a pink peg-wife in his car. He glares at it.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Few years ago it was fun. Year One, the traditional gift is paper—so at the end, she gave me a bound notebook.  GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I could write my novel.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: What'd you give her?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: A kite. She’d never flown a kite. Go spins; skips over the Get Married space.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Year Four: flowers. She led me to the dying rosebush in our backyard.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: The one you never watered...so symbolic. What’s the gift for five?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Wood.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: What’d you get her?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: There's no good gift for wood.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Go home, fuck her brains out, then smack her with your penis: Some wood for you, bitch! They laugh. Interrupted by the phone. Go answers.

dialogues.speaker: GO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Bar...Yep, hold on. (hand over mouthpiece) It's Watchful Wally!

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Bet my gutters need snaking. (picking up phone) Hey, Walter. What’s up?...Oh! that is weird. OK, thanks. (to Go) Bleecker’s outside.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: You are way too into that cat.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: He’s my special furry pal.  12 13 14 15 16 17 18 GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 10. He heads to the door, points at the LIFE board.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me how it ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK pulls up, salutes WALTER, who’s on his front porch behind a WALKER. WALTER gives a curt nod. BLEECKER is sit on the Dunne stairs. Nick scoops him up, heads to the FRO DOOR, which is GAPING WIDE OPEN. Nick stops in his tracks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK doesn’t close the door. He sets the cat down.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Amy? We follow Nick as he heads up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neat. Empty. An iron sits on an ironing board, pretty DRE next to it. No Amy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick proceeds—quickly—down the hallway, peering into door An OFFICE (his, a disaster); an elaborately pillowed GUES ROOM, and one room that contains only a LITTER BOX. Nick back downstairs, into: INT. DINING ROOM ~— DAY 16 Two placemats on the shiny table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy's office. Neat as a pin. Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick runs back through the DINING ROOM, into the:  GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 11. 19 INT. LIVING ROOM -— DAY 19 Nick stops short. The carpet is covered with GLASS SHARDS from the overturned coffee table. END TABLES are SMASHED; OTTOMAN is UPSIDE DOWN. NICK backs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter looks up from his paper as he hears, from across t street:

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (0.S8.)
dialogues.text: Amy!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOOR opens on RHONDA BONEY, 40s, and JIM GILPIN, 20s.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Mr. Dunne? I’m Detective Rhonda Boney and this is Officer James Gilpin. We understand there are concerns about your wife? Nick walks them in, shows them the scene.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: My wife is gone. I came home to this. They bend down, examine the scene. Hard to read if they’r impressed or not. BONEY takes a YELLOW POST-IT and places on the MANTEL below three upright photo FRAMES.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not someone who hits the panic button, but-It’s weird, right?

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: You mind if we look around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They speak in time to the stair steps.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: How long you two been here?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Two years, September. We used to live in New York.  GG ~ Blue Draft - 8/29/13 12.

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN
dialogues.text: City?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I was a writer. We were writers.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Why'd y'all come back here?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: My mom got sick.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, how is she?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: She's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boney reaches the landing, eyes Nick like a patient mom.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. They start down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what do you do now? For work.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Now I own The Bar, downtown. With my twin sister, Margo.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: The Bar! Love the name. Very meta. 24 INT. BEDROOM — DAY 24 Boney tests the IRON. Hot. Unplugs it. Looks at the dress

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Pretty dress. Date night?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s our anniversary. BONEY sticks another POST-IT on the IRONING BOARD.  25 26 27 28 GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick walks ahead with GILPIN as BONEY lingers: She sees o the baseboard three SPLASHES of rusty RED. Looks more cur than alarmed. A POST-IT down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BONEY enters. Checks out Amy’s desk area. BONEY flips thr Amy’s well-tended desk calendar: “NICK: DENTIST” is set f March 2013. In July 2013 is “BLEECKER: SHOTS.” Amy’s degr cover the walls: HARVARD undergrad, Masters in Psych. *

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Wow. Impressive gal. One small corner is dedicated to a kids’ book series, AMA AMY. Photos of Amy, at all ages, with her parents, RAND a MARYBETH, in front of posters for the books.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: So should I be con(cerned)-

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: (studying a picture) I remember these books. CLOSEUP of a dual frame: AMAZING AMY, the iconic cartoon drawing, is grinning from one side. Our real AMY ELLIOTT DUNNE is mimicking the same grin on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I remember these! Wait. Your wife is Amazing Amy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP of a DIARY, a PEN—advertising AMAZING AMy—is cursiving across. The eraser topper is a BRIDE with VEIL. date is February 24, 2007. We see the words as we hear: *

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Amazing Fucking Amy is getting fucking married! That’s how the night started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TINY book launch party. Posters advertise the AMAZING AMY book series—all 20. “Written by RAND and MARYBETH ELLIOTT psychologists—Who are parents JUST LIKE YOU!”  GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 14.

dialogues.speaker: AMY., (V.O.)
dialogues.text: With me—-regular, flawed, Real Amy—jealous, as always, of the golden child. Perfect, brilliant Amazing Amy. Who is getting fucking married. NICK and Amy are tight together. Waiters are circulating drinks, wearing T-shirts with an impish Amazing Amy and h TRADEMARK line: If it’s worth doing, it’s worth doing BRI

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Now you can say you came. And in 10 minutes we'll leave.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Perfect, time for a quick tour of my failings. They walk along the wall of BOOK POSTERS. Stop in front o poster of: gradeschool AMAZING AMY holding a CELLO. A MUT beside her.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When I was 10 I quit cello. In the next book, Amazing Amy became a prodigy. Next POSTER: teen AMAZING AMY playing volleyball.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You don’t play volleyball.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I got cut freshman year. She made varsity. They continue their tour.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: And how long did you have a dog?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: She got a dog. Puddles made her more relatable. They stop in front of the biggest poster: Amazing Amy, in bridal veil, a BLAND GROOM next to her. The banner reads: 30th Anniversary Special Edition-AMAZING AMY AND THE BIG

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I love your parents, but they can be assholes.  GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 15. In the center of the limp party, RAND and MARYBETH, 60s, cheerily hand out commemorative PENS-identical to the one used for her DIARY. Rand spots them-hands them each a pen

dialogues.speaker: RAND
dialogues.text: (to Amy) Hey, sweetheart, this is a big night for your mom. It would mean so much to her if you'd talk toa few reporters. Bloggers. Give ‘ema little “Amy” color. Painful pause. RAND (CONT’D) People want to hear from you.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We can’t stay long-

dialogues.speaker: RAND
dialogues.text: Fantastic! Fifteen minutes, tops! As Rand strides away, Nick gives Amy a look.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: This is why I have my trust fund, my Brooklyn brownstone. I can’t really complain.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Your parents plagiarized your childhood.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No, they improved upon it, and then peddled it to the masses. Marybeth pops up, a little tipsy, hugs them.

dialogues.speaker: MARYBETH
dialogues.text: I thought you were going to wear white to match the wedding theme.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I thought that’d be embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: MARYBETH
dialogues.text: (half joking) If it’s worth doing-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s worth doing..how’s that go?  GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 16. BRIGHT! BRIGHT! The waiters are everywhere in the T-shirt

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tip of my tongue...

dialogues.speaker: MARYBETH
dialogues.text: You're very cute, Nick. Amy, you know what would make Dad’s night-

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I’m on it. (to Nick) I love having strangers pick at my scabs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy, standing at a cocktail table, deals with a montage o New York media types. NICK hovers nearby.

dialogues.speaker: EARNEST GIRL
dialogues.text: I’m curious whether it’s difficult for you to watch Amazing Amy heading down the aisle-

dialogues.speaker: FASHIONISTA
dialogues.text: -and this big party celebrating this fictional wedding-

dialogues.speaker: NERVOUS INTERN
dialogues.text: Because my understanding is that you are not married-

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE-IT-ALL JOURNALIST
dialogues.text: Correct?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Correct. Amazing Amy is always, always one step ahead of me. Nick cuts in, blocks the journalist.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I have a few questions.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Ah, it’s you.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I am here in a strictly journalistic capacity. He elaborately sets out pad, pen. AMY prepares to be amus  GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 17.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Amy, you've had the pleasure of dating Nick Dunne for how long?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Two magical years.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Is it true that during the course of your relationship, you have performed such gracious gestures as (checking notes) ..-not correcting Nick when he pronounced quinoa as kwin-o-a.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: An understandable mistake.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: He also thought it was a fish.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: He thinks Velveeta is a cheese.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Touché.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I think it’s pronounced tow-chay.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (laughing) You also manage to appear surprised and delighted when Nick’s elderly mother breaks into “New York, New York” every...time...she sees you.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (crooning) These bag of bone shoes...

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You also bought Nick his first pair of scissors, correct?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: And matching stapler.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Amy Elliott, you are beyond amazing. You are incredibly smart but entirely unsnobby. You are kind but never a martyr. You surprise me. You challenge me. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 18.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And-fun fact for our readers—you have a world-class vagina. Amy chokes on her drink.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: However my colleagues inform me that as yet you are not married.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I am not.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Isn’t it time we fixed that?

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then the night wasn’t so bad anymore. 30 INT. POLICE STATION BULLPEN -— DAY GILPIN is watching NICK from the other side of the glass. NICK's fiddling with his smartphone. BONEY enters.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: How’s our boy?

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN
dialogues.text: He's just fucking with his phone. Playing, like, Tetris. They watch NICK a few more seconds.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: I remember him, you know? From when he was little. Cute kid. Straight out of a cereal commercial. Gilpin gives a bored grunt: he couldn’t care less.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gil? If this girl doesn’t show up...this could get out of hand.

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN
dialogues.text: Because of those books?

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Your wife likes those tabloid crime shows, right?

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN
dialogues.text: She’s an addict. 30  31 GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 19.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: OK, so: Beautiful wife, handsome husband-

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN
dialogues.text: Wife goes missing on her anniversary-

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: -turns out she’s the star of a book series every woman in the country read as a kid.

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: We are the cops of a suburb of a suburb. Let’s stay on our toes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BONEY, GILPIN and STEVE the TECH enter. STEVE is brandish a packet of wrapped Q-tips and his GSR kit.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Nick, this is Steve Eckert. He’s going to take a swab of your cheek and a hand swipe if that’s ok.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: This is for?

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN
dialogues.text: Gunshot residue, DNA.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Just so we can say we did. OK?

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: Steve is in and out with no eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: And now it’s done. Crossed off the list. Steve leaves. Nick watches his samples going out the door  GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 20. BONEY (CONT’D) Now, normally, we wouldn’t treat this as a missing persons case so quick. We'd tell you to call back in 24 hours. But given the scene in the house and given our spike in violent crime of late, we’re going to take this very, very seriously.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: OK. Good.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: So: We got forensics over at your place. You got somewhere to stay?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: My sister’s.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Good. We're tracking Amy’s phone, credit cards. We'll organize searches, put up flyers. We’ll hold a press conference tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: A press conference?!

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Want to get the word out, right? An officer comes in with two styrofoam cups of coffee, sl a manila envelope on the table. NICK smiles. BONEY frowns

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Sorry. I felt like I was in a Law and Order episode for a second. Bum- BUM.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: You're not, unfortunately. She stares at NICK, aggressively PONDERING.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, time is of the essence in these cases. That said, if you want to call a lawyer...

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No, no, whatever you need.  GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 21.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: OK, so you and Amy have been here two years. You tend bar.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I own The Bar. I also teach a creative-writing class at MVCC.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: No kids?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: No kids.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: So what does Amy do, most days? Woman with all those degrees, what does she do?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: She stays busy.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Doing what? Nick attempts a mental inventory. Fails.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: She’s a big reader. This lands as lamely as it sounds—and everyone notes it.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Days can get long. I know a few housewives, that evening glass of wine starts coming at noon. Or prescription pills-

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN
dialogues.text: Just last week: soccer mom, nice lady, got her teeth kicked in over some Oxycontin.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Ever since the mall went bust, half the town out of work...we can’t keep up with the drug problem.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I’m sure that’s not it.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Amy got friends we can talk to?  GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 22.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Not really. No.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: No friends. In this whole town.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: She was friendly with my mom... (pause) We've had a problem with the homeless in our neighborhood-

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN
dialogues.text: We'll look into it.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: So you got to The Bar around eleven today. Where were you before then? Just to cross that off.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Well, I was at home until 9 or so. Then I was at Sawyer Beach. Had my coffee, read the paper.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: You visit with anyone there?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I go there for the quiet. Nick picks off pieces of his Styrofoam cup; it squeaks.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: So your wife has no friends here. Is she kinda...stand-offish?...Ivy League? Nick is visibly uncomfortable. He squeaks at the styrofoa BONEY (CONT’D) Rub people the wrong way?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Well, she’s complicated. She has high expectations. Boney puts her hand on his to get him to stop the squeaki

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Type A. That can drive you crazy if you're not like that. You seem laid- back. Type B. Speaking of which: Amy's blood type?  GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 23.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: You don’t know if she has friends, you don't know how she spends her days, you don’t know her blood type?

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN
dialogues.text: Sure you guys are married?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Maybe 0?

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Her folks still in New York?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Can they get here in time for the press conference tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I haven't called them yet.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: You haven't called your wife’s parents?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I’ve been talking with you!

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Call them please, Nick. Now. NICK leaves—BONEY cocks an eyebrow at GILPIN. Door shuts.

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN
dialogues.text: Should I know my wife’s blood type?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick on a wall phone, pacing on the short leash of the co We hear MARYBETH’s TONE on the other end: FEMALE; ANGRY.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, Marybeth. I just kept hoping she’d walk back in the door.  33 GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 24.

dialogues.speaker: MARYBETH
dialogues.text: (a scattering of words) Played...tennis...on a plane now-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: We’re still not sure what we’re dealing with. The cops have been through the house and I’ve been at the station and we decided...at this point they’re taking it very seriously. And so I’m calling you.

dialogues.speaker: MARYBETH
dialogues.text: (a few words) Did they....know...if

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I’m not positive on that.

dialogues.speaker: MARYBETH
dialogues.text: Have they...started...

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I’m not sure...I’ve been juggling- A detective Rhonda Boney. But...OK. BONEY is standing outside the interrogation room.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My mother-in-law would like to speak with you. BONEY takes the phone and NICK walks down the hall, chastened, ANGRY. Splashes his face at the water fountain Breathes. Looks back at BONEY on the phone with Marybeth.

dialogues.speaker: BILL DUNNE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don’t want to be here. NICK stops in his tracks, listens. Peers into a holding r BILL DUNNE, 60s, bedraggled, is muttering to himself whil quietly FURIOUS FEMALE officer waits with him.

dialogues.speaker: BILL DUNNE
dialogues.text: I want to go home.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: What's going on? This is my dad.  GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 25.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Really? You're Nick Dunne. We've been calling you for hours.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I've been here talking to your detectives. My wife is missing. The officer begins to soften-

dialogues.speaker: BILL DUNNE
dialogues.text: Bitch.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Your father wandered out of Comfort Hill this morning. We found him walking Route 79. Disoriented. We’ve been calling. Nick holds up his phone. No bars.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I have zero reception. But I’ve been right goddam next door.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Sir, please don’t take that tone with me.

dialogues.speaker: BILL DUNNE
dialogues.text: Stupid, dumb bitch. BONEY is revealed to be in the doorway, listening.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: You want to drive him home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BONEY walks NICK to the EXIT. His dad is sitting in the passenger seat of his car.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Your dad seems nice. Nick laughs in spite of himself.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alzheimer’s?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: He's always been a misogynist asshole. 34  35 36 GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 26.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: You see him much?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Not since I was 10 and my mom finally divorced his ass. Boney gives him a pat.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Go sleep. Tomorrow will be long. She watches NICK head down the steps. GILPIN joins her.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s check the mall. Just because he says it’s not drug related-

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Let’s check Sawyer Beach. Two hours there-someone had to have seen him.

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN
dialogues.text: Will do.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: And let’s check into our guy here. See what kind of man he is.

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN
dialogues.text: He's the kind of man who plays Tetris while his wife is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK and his DAD drive SILENTLY through the town. Nick 35 reaches across his DAD and removes from his GLOVEBOX a CH DISPOSABLE phone. He dials. VOICEMAIL. Hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 He pulls up front of Comfort Hill Assisted Living. Helps DAD out and inside. Returns to car in seconds: Fastest dr off ever.  37 38 39 GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 : 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a souvenir BIG APPLE pen writing across the DIARY— at the top: July 5, 2009. We see the words as we hear:

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Everyone told us—and told us and told us-marriage is hard work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick is wearing a backpack, holding an Amy-blue CLUE as h makes his way; Amy follows, all grins.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And compromise...and more work. Abandon all hope, ye who enter. Nick is going past Z, past T, past 0, past H.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well it’s not true. Not for me and Nick. With us, two years—it’s just good.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I’m not crazy: “When young Amy's hope did wane, she wandered here in search of Jane.” Austen right? They arrive at the A’s.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were an alienated teen...and only Elizabeth Bennet understood you. He pulls out Pride and Prejudice. A BLUE ENVELOPE inside. kisses him. He reads the next clue. NICK (CONT‘D) You naughty minx. She kisses him again, deeply. Looks around. Stacks are em

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Technically we’re supposed to fuck at the next stop.  40 4l 42 GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 28.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: In keeping with tradition. She's already undoing his belt. Hand inside his jeans.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We've never fucked in a bookstore.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: God bless Jane Austen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bookshelf: Packed with books. One tumbles to the floor. Another. Another. Three at once as a hand busts through: trying to get a grip. Through the fallen books we can see Nick and Amy in patchwork: They look like an AD for SEX. INT. BAR - AFTERNOON 4l Nick and Amy, post-glow, clink glasses and swallow.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I haven't been here since...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I dragged you into the ladies’ room on our second date.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Why did we end up here?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It was January. We were cold. The light was on. They both sip.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Books, sex, bourbon. Life is good. Nick scans under the bar. Finds a blue ENVELOPE. Nick rea the CLUE.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And just got better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The table is strewn with dishes, desserts, drinks. A FEAS The waiter approaches with a gift box, sets it on the tab

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Year Two, cotton. Nick opens the top, peers in. A strange look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because, we had that joke, that our sex was too good for mere- He pulls out luxurious deep blue sheets. They’re out of t wrapping, folded like a newspaper with a bow.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So these are 2,000 thread count- Nick hands her his BACKPACK, grinning. Amy opens it, pull out a gift bag—and identical sheets. Nick kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sometimes I want to punch us in the face we're so cute. They kiss again. Stay close.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (whispering) That’s crazy though, isn’t it? EXT. GO’S HOUSE - ESTABLISHING —- NIGHT 44 INT. GO’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 45 Go is shaking out SHEETS—200 count—while Nick paces.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Did they ask if you wanted a lawyer? She tucks the sheets into the couch.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I don’t need a lawyer. Go Did they ask you personal stuff? About Amy?  46 GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 30.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: They asked why she has no friends here.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: What'd you say?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I just said she was complicated.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Nick, everyone knows “complicated” is code for bitch. Nick’s phone BUZZES in his pocket. Go is getting bourbon. hits OFF. She returns with two glasses and a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: GO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I feel sick. It’s so bizarre. It just seems like the kind of thing that would happen to Amy. She always attracts-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Drama. You're with me, Go. You can say it.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Just because I don’t love Amy doesn’t mean I don’t care about her. I'm really scared. Go tosses a pillow at Nick, waits for a reaction. Nothing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BONEY is drinking a huge COFFEE as she and GILPIN walk to the house. We can see a half block away, NOELLE HAWTHORNE PREGNANT, towing identically dressed toddler TRIPLETS.

dialogues.speaker: NOELLE
dialogues.text: Detective, detective! Noelle catches up. An air of annoying self-importance. In background, we can see cops scouring the neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: NOELLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm Noelle Hawthorne. I’m Amy’s best friend. Boney and Gilpin exchange a look: A friend?!  47 48 GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 31.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Wow, great. Where do you live, Noelle?

dialogues.speaker: NOELLE
dialogues.text: Five doors down, 1022.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Wonderful. I'd love to talk with you, thank you. Can I come by in half an hour?

dialogues.speaker: NOELLE
dialogues.text: Do you know anything yet?

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, I got guys on the clock. Give me 30 minutes?

dialogues.speaker: NOELLE
dialogues.text: That's usually bathtime.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: We'll talk between shampoos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half dozen officers are on scene: photos, fingerprints. OFFICERS ARE BAGGING ALL THE TRASH. BONEY, GILPIN and DONNELLY, forensics, hit the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: So where are we?

dialogues.speaker: DONNELLY
dialogues.text: That is definitely blood spatter you saw in the kitchen. Normally, kitchen; knives; food prep; not that weird. But the positioning is awfully strange. I'll order a Luminol sweep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they reach the bedroom, we can see an officer next doo Nick’s OFFICE, SIFTING through the contents of the FIREPL and BAGGING. A uniformed officer awaits them in the BEDRO

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN
dialogues.text: House is rented, in her name. Car is in her name. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Phones, credit cards, utilities all in her name. Even his bar is in her name. 31a.  49 GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 32.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: I don’t know that’s so surprising.

dialogues.speaker: GILPIN
dialogues.text: No, but it is humiliating.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: (motioning to closet) It’s way in the back there. BONEY heads into the walk-in, dresses and shirts swaying she passes. At the far back is Amy’s dresser. A drawer is open. Inside is a BLUE ENVELOPE marked CLUE ONE. BONEY ex the closet displaying it for GILPIN.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: We have our First Clue! She rips open the envelope. INT. GO’S LIVING ROOM - MORNING 49 NICK is asleep on the couch, an empty bottle of bourbon n to him. GO nudges him awake, proffering a Coke and Advil. Nick takes them silently, guzzles the Coke, checks his wa

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: July 6, 2012

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I should shower.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Go just like that. You’ve been up all night. You want to look like you've been up all night. (pause) Be careful today, OK?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: That’s a weird thing to say.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: When you're upset, you bottle up. You can seem...angry...like-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Please don’t say like Dad.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Or else you swing into your Mama's boy charm offensive—it can feel glib.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Great, I’ll try to balance on the exact edge of your emotional razor. Fucking press conference. co Just be-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Myself? Silence. Because the obvious answer is no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK and GO arrive at the police station and get out of c INT. POLICE STATION — DAY 52 BONEY walks NICK and GO in. The busy crowd of cops parts: see RAND and MARYBETH, SUITCASES at their feet.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Your in-laws made it. NICK approaches warily. RAND hugs him fiercely. MARYBETH stays outside the circle.

dialogues.speaker: MARYBETH
dialogues.text: We played tennis last night, Nick! I just can’t get over it.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Marybeth, I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: RAND
dialogues.text: (to Marybeth) We're here now.

dialogues.speaker: MARYBETH
dialogues.text: I knew you shouldn’t have moved back here.  53 54 GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 34.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (pointed) We didn’t have a lot of choice.

dialogues.speaker: RAND
dialogues.text: We are all worried, we are all scared. But we are all here now, and we will find Amy. Together. He pulls MARYBETH in on the hug. She allows it but keeps tracking EVERYTHING in the office. INT. POLICE STATION ~— DAY 53 Boney and Go POV on group hug.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: They get along? co Honestly, here’s the secret to Nick. He looks like the preppy asshole from the ‘80s teen movie, but he’s really the A/V nerd with the pet ferret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BONEY leads the ELLIOTTS and NICK into a room of a HALF D BORED LOCAL REPORTERS: Texting, eating, gabbing. As they catch sight of handsome NICK, they put down their sandwic AMY's gorgeous MISSING poster is revealed. An AMAZING AMY book jacket is revealed. Everyone is extremely attentive.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming. My wife, Amy Elliott Dunne, went missing from our home on July 5 between 9 am and 11:30 am under very concerning circumstances. We ask for anyone who may have knowledge of what has happened to her to come forward. And...he’s done? Rand steps in.

dialogues.speaker: RAND
dialogues.text: Amy is our only child. She’s smart and beautiful and kind. She really is Amazing Amy. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 55 GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 35.

dialogues.speaker: RAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know there are millions of people out there who grew up with her and care about her. We care about her, we love her and we want her back.

dialogues.speaker: MARYBETH
dialogues.text: Amy is a decorated scholar. She forged a successful career in journalism. She returned here to her husband's hometown, and she made a life in her adopted home. Now Amy needs your help. We are setting up a volunteer headquarters at the Drury Lodge. We have a hotline, 1-855-4-AMY-TIPS and our website is FindAmazingAmy.com. Nick and the Elliotts pause for a few photos. The Elliott look devastated; NICK looks annoyed. A PHOTOG asks Nick t pose next to Amy’s photo: a demented PROM SHOT. SNAP! NICK looks more annoyed. He glances at GO; she prods him SMILE. NICK flashes a sudden, smarmy SMILE, overly charmi and oily. The CAMERAS click crazily. SNAP! SNAP! He drops INT. POLICE CONFERENCE ROOM — DAY 55 BONEY, RAND AND MARYBETH and NICK are at a conference tab Boney is taking notes. The Elliotts have their two suitca with them. They open one: It’s filled with “AMY FILES”: P albums, news clippings, Amazing Amy books.

dialogues.speaker: MARYBETH
dialogues.text: We have suspects you’1ll want to look at, Detective. Rand is pulling out photos, notes, from a manila envelope

dialogues.speaker: RAND
dialogues.text: Amy's the kind of girl who attracts admirers. Tell her, Nick.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: It’s very true.

dialogues.speaker: RAND
dialogues.text: We've had a few instances where things got-

dialogues.speaker: MARYBETH
dialogues.text: Scary. (to Nick) Do you know about Desi Collings?  GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 36. A photo flies into frame: AMY, in an old prom shot with D COLLINGS. Boarding-school beautiful. It echoes the “prom shot” we just saw of Nick and “Cardboard Amy.” Silence.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Yes. I know all about Desi. I know he writes her letters.

dialogues.speaker: MARYBETH
dialogues.text: He was obsessed. He attempted suicide after Amy broke up with him sophomore year. We filed a restraining order.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: This would be high school...20 years ago?

dialogues.speaker: MARYBETH
dialogues.text: He moved to St. Louis-that’s just two hours away-

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: To be fair, he’s from St. Louis—he moved back. I’ve read his letters. They're friendly.

dialogues.speaker: MARYBETH
dialogues.text: Threatening?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Friendly.

dialogues.speaker: RAND
dialogues.text: We also have Tommy O’Hara. This was only eight years ago in New York. She broke up with him-he got very physical. She filed charges.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I did not know this.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: (taking notes) What was the charge? Sexual assault? Battery? Threat?

dialogues.speaker: RAND
dialogues.text: I only know it was bad.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: OK. Thank you. Anything...recent?  56 57 58 GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BONEY is walking them out. Reporters are closing in like curious sharks. As RAND and MARYBETH answer a few nibbles BONEY grabs NICK. A bit clandestine.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Got a minute? INT. BONEY’S OFFICE - DAY 57 In the center of BONEY’s desk sits the ENVELOPE: CLUE ONE

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Imagine our confusion: missing persons case, and here we find an envelope marked CLUE.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: For our anniversary Amy always did * this treasure hunt- *

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: Hoping you can tell me what this * means.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You want to solve my wife’s treasure hunt?

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: It’'ll help us track Amy’s movements * before she disappeared: Where she went, who she might have seen. : * He takes the clue, doubtfully, dreadfully, and reads.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: “Although this spot couldn't be * tighter/it’s a cozy room for my * favorite writer” I think I know * this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICK and BONEY weave past bored summer-school kids. NICK reaches his office, finds his key, steps over a pile of M

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: After-school meeting? Don’t mind if * I do...  59 GG - Yellow Revisions 9/27/13 38. INT. NICK’S COLLEGE OFFICE - DAY 59 It’s dust mote-y, messy, CRAMPED.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Maybe I‘'1l teach you a thing or two. The blue ENVELOPE-CLUE TWO-sits in the center of Nick’s d He gives a glance to BONEY before touching it.

dialogues.speaker: BONEY
dialogues.text: My guest. He picks up a pair of SCISSORS that sit next to a MATCHIN STAPLER and opens it. Boney reads over his shoulder. INSERT on note: Hey, handsome man—let’s go undercover. dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I just- I’ve had a job since I was 12. I mowed lawns and dug post holes and flipped burgers. I worked all these shitty jobs so I could go to college, and get a job. I don’t know how to not have a job.

dialogues.speaker: NICK

GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 46.

dialogues.text: 75 76 GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 49.

dialogues.text: Marybeth, I’m in a nightmare here. I'm just trying to be nice to the people who are trying to find Amy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee OF  81 GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 51. INT. GO’S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 81 Go is nursing a beer. ON TV: ELLEN ABBOTT, blow-dried, red-lipped, leather- jacketed, and in a photo box is NICK and his KILLER SMILE

dialogues.text: Look at that pie-eating grin. From a guy whose wife is missing. Kinda weird, dontcha think?

dialogues.text: How’re you doing? He gives a shrug.

dialogues.text: How's Marybeth?

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: She’s freaked out.

dialogues.text: And you? He waits her out.

dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Everything.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Why would you even say that?

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Ever since you walked into the Bar, the morning Amy went missing...you feel...off.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: I am off. (long pause) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 52.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go, everyone is studying me, everyone is projecting their shit onto me. All I want right now is to sit with you and drink a beer and not be judged. Can we please just do that?

dialogues.text: Of course. They drink in silence. Go examines the hand-crocheted yar cozie on her beer. GO (CONT’D) You know what I keep thinking?

dialogues.text: Love you.

dialogues.text: A MISSOURI SOUVENIR PEN cursives across the DIARY. DATE: September 23, 2010. We see the words as we hear:

dialogues.text: So here’s a strange new sentence: I am a Missourian. 83 INT./EXT. NICK’S CAR - BROWNSTONE - DAY Nick and Amy pull away, a MOVING VAN behind them. The brownstone recedes in the rearview mirror, RAND and MARYB waving goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: No money, no jobs. And then we heard from Go. Mama Maureen. Stage four. Breast cancer. So we moved to Missouri. I don’t mind. I just wished he’d asked. te HO  84 85 86 GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 53.

dialogues.text: Nick is happy to be home, but I don’t know if he’s happy I’m with him. Nick runs to hug GO and MO, completely forgetting AMY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy stands in the middle of the future Scene of the Crime it slowly fills with furniture.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I feel like something he loaded by mistake. Something to be jettisoned if necessary. Something disposable. NICK puts an arm around her, gives her a smile.

Just inside his bag, his DISPOSABLE buzze INSERT on DISPLAY: im outside open up. BUZZ. Nick wakes. BUZZ. Reads. Jumps up. FLINGS the FRONT door open. Just a quiet, dark street. He runs to the BACK DOOR, FLINGS it OPEN: There is ANDIE, 20, a cheerful fuck of a girl. AMY’s beautiful; ANDIE’s hot. NICK yanks her i

dialogues.text: Andie, shit!

dialogues.speaker: ANDIE
dialogues.text: I saw you on TV. It’s so insane. She just vanished? She wraps herself around one of his arms like a child.

dialogues.text: She’s just gone.  GG - Blue Draft - 8/29/13 54.

dialogues.text: I’ve been so worried about you.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: You’re impossible to reach. You gotta pick up when I call you—where the hell have you been?

dialogues.speaker: ANDIE
dialogues.text: Rehearsals.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: (absolutely baffled) What?

dialogues.speaker: ANDIE
dialogues.text: Godspell! Nick can’t believe it. He collapses on the couch. Andie s next to him. She cuddles into him. Nuzzles his cheek.

dialogues.text: My sister's asleep. You really shouldn't be here, Andie.

dialogues.text: I love you. But, sweetheart, we have to be real careful right now. She pulls him toward her.

dialogues.text: I've been so scared.

dialogues.speaker: NICK
dialogues.text: Between rehearsals.

dialogues.text: You told me I needed to have my own life. She places his arms around her. Whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: ANDIE, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: They lie down side by side on the marital bed. Nick is staring at the back of Amy’s head, just as in the opening

dialogues.speaker: NICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What are you thinking? How are you feeling? What have we done to each other? What will we do? Amy turns, and gives him a haunting SMILE. FADE TO BLACK.
